name: Character Sheet
content:
Character Sheet

Figure 1: Character Sheet

 

  1. Characters name

  2. Level
    When updating this field it triggers certain fields to update on the character sheet. So you have to change your level to gain the perks from your Ancestry and Paths.

    • Ancestry: On level 4 it automatically increase you total health by the number written. 
    • Paths: It automatically adds Health, Talents and Spells that matches your current level and below.

  3. Attributes
    Determined by your Ancestry and Paths.

    The large circle represents the value of your attribute the smaller number in the top right is your modifier that will be added to your rolls.

    Perception: Is derived from Intellect and is automatically calculated.

    ðŸŽ² Clicking on the attribute name allows you to make a challenge roll.

  4. Characteristics
    All except for Fortune is automatically calculated and they too are based on your Ancestry and Paths.

    Damage, Insanity and Corruption are represented by a bar.
    Left-clicked on the title/label to increase the value and Right-clicked to decrease in value. Alternatively, click the edit button (square+pencil icon) and you can manually type in the value.

    • Defense: Is calculated based on your agility, ancestry, paths and armor.
    • Power: Can be changed on your ancestry.
    • Size and Speed: Are values from your ancestry.
    • Healing Rate: Calculated from your ancestry and total health.
      Injured: A checkmark box.
    • Fast/Slow Turn: A button to toggle your fast/slow turn order.

  5. Character Info
    General fields to describe your characters looks.

    • Ancestry: When you drag and drop an Ancestry Item onto the character sheet it’ll show up here.

      When a plus icon is shown in the fields, you can create a blank Ancestry and fill in the blanks. Usually you don’t do this. The GM creates Ancestry item that you can drag/drop onto your character sheet. They are predefined with the values you need.

      When an edit button is shown, you can click to show and edit the Ancestry item. This will be covered in further detail in the Ancestries journal entry.

      @JournalEntry[woNOPU8AlflnL338]{Ancestries}

    • Religion: You can enter a text and choose an image to represent your religious believes.

    • Languages: A list of languages known to the character.
      The system comes with a set of language items. You can import them and drag/drop them unto the character sheet. Starting languages is part of your ancestry and will automatically be added when an ancestry is chosen. This will be covered in further detail in the Ancestry journal entry.

      You can click on the edit button to edit your languages. Trashcan to delete or select the R/W/S (Read/Write/Spoken) characters to toggle on/off.



  6. Paths
    When a Path item is dragged/dropped onto your character sheet they will show up here and an edit button is shown.

    Paths will be covered in further detail in the Paths journal entry.

  7. Professions
    Drag and drop your Profession items or create your own.

  8. Features
    Drag and drop your Feature items or create your own.

  9. Character image
    Click on the image to choose an image for your character.

  10. Toggle PC/NPC
    A botton to toggle between PC or an NPC sheet. Right now it only changes the image frame and the sidebar graphics. See Figure 2.

  11. Character Mods
    A separate popup window where you can set Afflictions and add modifiers if you are effected by a spell. This will be covered in further detail in the Character Mod journal entry.



Figure 2: NPC Character Sheet
